children.subject: 170 and 127 together sounds pretty rough tbh wouldn't recommend unless youre really up for it

history.content:
Would not recommend 170 + 127 unless you are taking 127 P/NP and are taking them with friends you can work on problem sets together, then maybe. Both classes have problem sets that are quite time consuming even for the best of students (~20+ hrs/week each) and very likely their deadlines overlap at some points. I also assume you will be recruiting in the Fall, and having two problem set based courses will be quite rough in managing an interview schedule (may or may not include on-sites). However, you know your work habits best, and worse case you can just drop one later after a week or two.

__________________________________

I am not sure why Steven Tan keeps bringing up recruiting all the damn time like its some major constraint to the schedule. As a senior with a lot of experience in recruiting, I can safely say that apart from the "big" names, most of the companies do their recruiting in early Spring, not Fall.

@OP, 4 techs, regardless of their difficulty, is always pretty challenging and not advised for most people. I think if you don't do either phy or data 8, the rest of the schedule seems fine to me, although challenging.

Would not recommend 170 + 127 unless you are taking 127 P/NP and are taking them with friends you can work on problem sets together, then maybe. Both classes have problem sets that are quite time consuming even for the best of students (~20+ hrs/week each) and very likely their deadlines overlap at some points. children.subject: damn lol. I really want to take 126 because I want to take 189 the following spring. What do u recommend with 126?
i think its fine to take 126 and 170 together with nothing else if you want to do well in both. You can force 1 more tech but be prepared to compromise a little.

history.content:
CS 170

EE 127

Data 8

Phys 8A

Is this a good/doable schedule? Taking physics cuz i always wanted to take physics and 8 series seemed to be lowest stress. I am a sophomore cs major.
history.subject: EECS Schedule Help
